name: ListDataObjects
description:
Retrieve a list of data objects from a specified collection.

Use this tool to get a list of data objects from a particular collection by providing the collection name parameter. The objects are returned in reverse order of creation.

parameters.name: threshold_uuid_after
parameters.description: A UUID to retrieve objects after, excluding this object. Use with `class` and `limit`. Leave empty for the start.

value_schema.description:
A threshold UUID of the objects to retrieve after, using an UUID-based ordering. This object is not part of the set.

Must be used with collection name (`class`), typically in conjunction with `limit`.

Note `after` cannot be used with `offset` or `sort`.

For a null value similar to offset=0, set an empty string in the request, i.e. `after=` or `after`.

parameters.name: query_start_index
parameters.description: The starting index for the result window. Retrieves `offset+limit` results and returns `limit` results from this index onward. Cannot be used with `after`. Should be used with `limit`.

value_schema.description:
The starting index of the result window. Note `offset` will retrieve `offset+limit` results and return `limit` results from the object with index `offset` onwards. Limited by the value of `QUERY_MAXIMUM_RESULTS`.

Should be used in conjunction with `limit`.

Cannot be used with `after`.

parameters.name: maximum_items_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to be returned per page. The default is 25 unless set otherwise as an environment variable.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of items to be returned per page. The default is 25 unless set otherwise as an environment variable.

parameters.name: include_additional_information
parameters.description: Include additional information types such as `classification`, `vector`, or `interpretation`.

value_schema.description: Include additional information, such as classification information. Allowed values include: `classification`, `vector` and `interpretation`.

parameters.name: sort_properties
parameters.description: Names of properties to sort by, e.g., 'city' or 'country,city'.

value_schema.description: Name(s) of the property to sort by - e.g. `city`, or `country,city`.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Specify how to order the data within the sorted field(s). Use 'asc' for ascending and 'desc' for descending. Should match the order of fields used in `sort`. Multiple values should be separated by commas.

value_schema.description: Order parameter to tell how to order (asc or desc) data within given field. Should be used in conjunction with `sort` parameter. If providing multiple `sort` values, provide multiple `order` values in corresponding order, e.g.: `sort=author_name,title&order=desc,asc`.

parameters.name: collection_name
parameters.description: Specifies the collection name to query objects from. If not provided, no objects will be returned.

value_schema.description:
The collection from which to query objects.

Note that if the collection name (`class`) is not provided, the response will not include any objects.

parameters.name: tenant_identifier
parameters.description: Specifies the tenant for requests targeting a multi-tenant collection (class).

value_schema.description: Specifies the tenant in a request targeting a multi-tenant collection (class).

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the weaviate API.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
A threshold UUID of the objects to retrieve after, using an UUID-based ordering. This object is not part of the set.

Must be used with collection name (`class`), typically in conjunction with `limit`.

Note `after` cannot be used with `offset` or `sort`.

For a null value similar to offset=0, set an empty string in the request, i.e. `after=` or `after`.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
The starting index of the result window. Note `offset` will retrieve `offset+limit` results and return `limit` results from the object with index `offset` onwards. Limited by the value of `QUERY_MAXIMUM_RESULTS`.

Should be used in conjunction with `limit`.

Cannot be used with `after`.

value_schema.description:

Should be used in conjunction with `limit`.

Cannot be used with `after`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to be returned per page. The default is 25 unless set otherwise as an environment variable.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of items to be returned per page. The default is 25 unless set otherwise as an environment variable.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Include additional information, such as classification information. Allowed values include: `classification`, `vector` and `interpretation`.

value_schema.description: Include additional information, such as classification information. Allowed values include: `classification`, `vector` and `interpretation`.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Name(s) of the property to sort by - e.g. `city`, or `country,city`.

value_schema.description: Name(s) of the property to sort by - e.g. `city`, or `country,city`.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Order parameter to tell how to order (asc or desc) data within given field. Should be used in conjunction with `sort` parameter. If providing multiple `sort` values, provide multiple `order` values in corresponding order, e.g.: `sort=author_name,title&order=desc,asc`.

value_schema.description: Order parameter to tell how to order (asc or desc) data within given field. Should be used in conjunction with `sort` parameter. If providing multiple `sort` values, provide multiple `order` values in corresponding order, e.g.: `sort=author_name,title&order=desc,asc`.

parameters.name: class
parameters.description:
The collection from which to query objects.

Note that if the collection name (`class`) is not provided, the response will not include any objects.

Note that if the collection name (`class`) is not provided, the response will not include any objects.

parameters.description: Specifies the tenant in a request targeting a multi-tenant collection (class).
